instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boots with white screen
threads.message:
Hello,
i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A which starts up just fine but after the apple Logo finishes loading and i choose an account the screen stays just white. It had liquid damage and has a new keyboard. The board it shelf looks very clean. No evidence of water there. Same thing if i want so reinstall the OS. But Apple Logo and Boot device selection menu is displayed perfectly fine as long as i want (did not turn white after some time). Can this be related to <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>? i measured voltage and for a few seconds it is 1.5V as it should be but than it turns into 1,355V and stays there.
Thanks for any help!
Regards
Felix

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boots with white screen
threads.message: GPU failure. If the board and machine has been cleaned well enough you should take it to Apple for a free repair under the GPU warranty program.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boots with white screen
threads.message: Thank you for this incredible fast reply :)  Some probe points are slightly brown but i hope they wonÂ´t open it if i take it directly to the store. Thanks for the advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boots with white screen
threads.message: Uhm, someone is going to open it and if it has obvious corrosion it will be rejected. Make sure it is as clean as possible. Maybe post a link to a good HiRes picture here so I can judge if this is going to be rejected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boots with white screen
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boots with white screen
threads.message:
I've taken LOTS of these boards in. just make sure the water indicators are white, and that there isn't any noticeable corrosion/damage or sticky keys and you should be alright. 

Note: If you take too many of them in they will start to have a freak out lmao.
